Game Recap: Women's Basketball | 12/30/2023 8:24:00 PM

Charlotte Defeats North Texas 74-64; Picks Up First Win in American

CHARLOTTE, N.C. – The Charlotte women's basketball team picked up their first American Athletic Conference win in program history on Saturday (Dec. 30) inside Halton Arena as they defeated the University of North Texas Mean Green by a score of 74-64.

FIRST GAME IN THE AMERICAN

Saturday's contest marked the first American Athletic Conference game for both sides, both coming from C-USA where they faced off 16 times since the 2013-14 season.

SERIES HISTORY

Charlotte and North Texas had met 16 times before, with the 49ers holding a 12-4 record. UNT defeated CLT by a score of 66-59 last season. At Halton Arena, the 49ers were 7-0 versus the Mean Green coming into today.

QUICK TIMEOUT

North Texas got off to a hot start with a 9-0 run to begin the game, forcing an early timeout from head coach Cara Consuegra. The Mean Green had an efficient first quarter of offense as they attacked the basket to create open looks, shooting 8-for-18 while making two three-pointers. Tommisha Lampkin was a force in the paint with 8 points as she made all four of her attempts. The biggest lead in the quarter was 10 for UNT, as they led 21-12 after 10 minutes.

20 TO 2 RUN

Charlotte started out the second quarter by scoring the first eight points to cut the deficit to 21-20, and tied the game at 23 on a layup from Tracey Hueston to force a North Texas timeout. Dazia Lawrence scored 14 points in the period on 6-for-8 shooting, highlighting a 20-2 run for the Niners as they led 32-23 with two minutes remaining. Lawrence and Smith played the entirety of the second, finishing with a +/- of +16. The Niners shot 10-21, outrebounded the Mean Green 11 to five, and forced 10 turnovers as they outscored North Texas 23 to seven in the quarter to take a 35-28 lead into halftime.

SHOOTING WOES IN THE THIRD

Buckets were at a premium in the third quarter as both teams combined to shoot 10-for-31 from the floor and 1-7 on three-pointers. Tracey Hueston picked up her third foul midway through the third quarter, but in stepped freshman Fatou Diakite. She finished with three blocks in just 12 minutes off the bench, coming up big defensively for the Niners in helping preserve the lead. Going into the fourth, CLT led 49 to 44.

HIGH SCORING FOURTH

Both teams found their rhythm offensively as the final 10 minutes were back and forth with made baskets. CLT shot 10-for-13 as a team, once again led by Dazia Lawrence who had nine in the period while making all four attempts. Jaaucklyn Moore scored seven of her 11 points down the stretch, helping North Texas cut the lead to 61-55 with under four minutes remaining. On the following possession, Lawrence found Jacee Busick for the clutch three-pointer to extend the advantage back to nine. The dagger proved to be on the next offensive possession for Charlotte when Tracey Hueston found Keanna Rembert for the easy layup, fueling the 74-64 victory for the first win in the American.

INSIDE THE BOX SCORE

Preseason Second Team selection in the American Dazia Lawrence stepped up with 23 points (11-20) and three steals to lead Charlotte to victory. Imani Smith played 35 minutes off the bench on her way to finishing with 11 points, 10 rebounds, six assists, three blocks, and two steals in an all-around effort. Jewel Watkins and Fatou Diakite both gave great minutes off the bench as well, combining to score 11 points as they made impact plays on both ends of the floor.

Charlotte out-rebounded North Texas 40 to 31, including four more offensive rebounds. 46 of CLT's points came in the paint, and 22 of them off turnovers. The Mean Green coughed the ball up on 22 occasions, compared to 17 from the Niners. Bench points (22) was a deciding factor in the outcome along with the free throw comparison, where Charlotte shot 72.2% compared to 46.2% from North Texas.

COACH CONSUEGRA ON THE WIN

"North Texas is a great team, they made us earn this win. Coach Burton has done a great job in his first year with the program. They got off to a great start, but our team never wavered and hung in there. Our team stayed focused on the next play. We saw a lot of progress today and we are proud of the effort."

"For us to come away with the win against a great North Texas team in our first conference game in the American shows how far we have come as a team. It is a privilege for us to be the first Charlotte women's basketball team to play in this conference. Going forward, we must stay the course."

DAZIA LAWRENCE ON IMANI SMITH

"Smitty brings the energy off the bench, we go as she goes. She made an impact the minute she came onto the court and gave us a much-needed lift on both ends of the floor."

HIGHLIGHTS

NEXT UP

Charlotte travels to Tampa, Florida on Wednesday (Jan. 3) for an away game at South Florida. Opening tip is scheduled for 7:00 p.m., with video, radio, and live stats links available online.
